thread.title: Mother, 32, dies in Swindon after being hit by roadsweeper at crossroads on her way to pick her child up from minder
thread.title_full: Mother, 32, dies in Swindon after being hit by roadsweeper at crossroads on her way to pick her child up from minder

title: Mother, 32, dies in Swindon after being hit by roadsweeper at crossroads on her way to pick her child up from minder
text:
Opinion ROAD CRASH TRAGEDY Mother, 32, dies in Swindon after being hit by roadsweeper at crossroads on her way to pick her child up from minder by EMMA LAKE Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments A MUM, 32, has died after being hit by a roadsweeper at a crossroads while on her way to pick up her child. 
The woman was struck at a crossroads in Swindon as she went to collect her child from a minder. 
She died at the scene of the collision, in Hyde Road, just before 4.30pm on Thursday. 
No arrests have been made in what Inspector David Ibbott described as an ongoing investigation over what appeared to be a “tragic accident”. 
Wilshire Police said: “A white road maintenance vehicle was in collision with a pedestrian. 
“A 32 year old lady from Swindon sadly died at the scene. 
“Next of kin have been informed and formal identification will take place in due course.” 
Anyone who witnessed the incident, or was in the area at the time, is asked to call Wiltshire Police on 101, or Crimestoppers on 0800 555 111.
